natural solution: We have that \[\tan (90^\circ - x) = \frac{\sin (90^\circ - x)}{\cos (90^\circ - x)} = \frac{\cos x}{\sin x} = \frac{1}{\tan x}.\]Then \[\log_{10} \tan x + \log_{10} \tan (90^\circ - x) = \log_{10} (\tan x \tan (90^\circ - x)) = \log_{10} 1 = 0.\]Summing over $x = 1^\circ,$ $2^\circ,$ $\dots,$ $44^\circ,$ the sum reduces to $\log_{10} \tan 45^\circ = \boxed{0}.$

fixes log10 :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and tan :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
